definition: self/oneself/sixth of the ten Heavenly Stems 十天干[shi2 tian1 gan1]/sixth in order/letter "F" or Roman "VI" in list "A, B, C", or "I, II, III" etc/hexa
to reform and open to the outside world/refers to Deng Xiaoping's policies from around 1980
to change one's costume/to repackage/to remodel/to refit/to modify/to convert
to correct/to amend/to put right/correction/CL:個|个[ge4]
change of appearance/to revise one's point of view

sentences.english: We need to modify the fifth article of the contract.
sentences.chinese: 合同書的第五條第一款要改一下。

sentences.english: It's just asking you if you wanna change the name.
sentences.chinese: 也就是問你，要不要改文件名。

sentences.english: Names in this story have been changed to protect the interviewees.
sentences.chinese: 這篇報道中的人名都被改了，以保護被採訪人。

sentences.english: And then we'll need to eat them PDQ, too!
sentences.chinese: 我們改去麥當勞吧，快餐店應該不會等太久。

sentences.english: The editor hacked the story to bits.
sentences.chinese: 編輯把那篇小說改得面目全非。

sentences.english: The measures to solve these problems are to change the sowing afforestation to the planting.
sentences.chinese: 解決的主要辦法是改傳統的直播造林爲植苗造林。

sentences.english: Turn the dough out into a lightly oiled bowl. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap or a damp towel.
sentences.chinese: 放到一個抹了薄油的盆裏，改上保鮮膜或溼毛巾。

sentences.english: Then i had a long session of tailoring in the changing room with, of course the tailor.
sentences.chinese: 然後我和裁縫在試衣間花了很長時間改衣服。

sentences.english: The teacher returned to her room to correct exercise books.
sentences.chinese: 老師回到房間去改練習簿。

sentences.english: And "change" refers to unleashing staff potential through deepening reform.
sentences.chinese: 改，就是通過深化改革推動機構編制釋放潛力。

sentences.english: Have courage and ask. Then you know what you have to deal with.
sentences.chinese: 鼓起勇氣去問問他，然後你就知道你改怎麼做了。

sentences.english: The ‘letter’ has been changed as it is no longer a people's heart and a simple love letter.
sentences.chinese: 大概信不再言心，不再是表白真心的情書了才改的。

sentences.english: Every body, who k tell me how to chg city name???
sentences.chinese: 大家誰能告訴我怎麼改城市名？

sentences.english: I am a vulgar person, the skeleton used to dissolute , can't change also don't want to change.
sentences.chinese: 我是一個俗人，形骸放浪慣了，改不了也不想改。

sentences.english: "Not very easily, " he says. Oh, God.
The time of talk has been swithed to the afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 已將會談舉行時間改在下午了。

definition: to convert/to turn into (sth else)/to adapt (a story to another medium)
abbr. for Xinjiang 新疆[Xin1 jiang1] or Singapore 新加坡[Xin1 jia1 po1]/surname Xin
to change/to become different/to transform/to vary/rebellion
to adjust one's head and turn one's face (idiom); cosmetic changes/Despite superficially new policies, the substance remains unchanged.
to succeed/to finish/to complete/to accomplish/to become/to turn into/to be all right/OK!/one tenth
